bugs.title: Clam AntiVirus: Off-by-one error by scanning message hashes [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: Clam AntiVirus: Off-by-one error by scanning message hashes [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2011-2721 Clam AntiVirus: Off-by-one error by scanning message hashes

long_desc.thetext:
An off-by-one error was found in the way the hash manager of Clam AntiVirus, a GPL anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, performed scan of messages with certain hashes. A remote attacker could provide a message with specially-crafted hash signature in it, leading to denial of service (clamscan executable crash).

Upstream bug report:
[1] https://wwws.clamav.net/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=2818

Relevant patch:
[2] http://git.clamav.net/gitweb?p=clamav-devel.git;a=commit;h=4842733eb3f09be61caeed83778bb6679141dbc5

Other references:
[3] https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=708263
[4] http://git.clamav.net/gitweb?p=clamav-devel.git;a=blob_plain;f=ChangeLog;hb=clamav-0.97.2
[5] http://www.clamav.net/lang/en/

This issue affects the versions of the clamav package, as shipped with Fedora release of 14 and 15. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue affects the versions of the clamav package, as present within EPEL-4, EPEL-5, and EPEL-6 repositories. Please schedule an update.

Created clamav tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: epel-all [bug 725695]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 725696]

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by janfrode.
This update has been obsoleted by https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/clamav-0.97.2-3.el6

notes:
- updated to 0.97.2
- Build-require xz
- CVE-2011-2721 Off-by-one error by scanning message hashes (#725694)
- include updated clamd-wrapper which get the PidFile setting from the service configuration file.
